item.description:
MOVIE IS ON FOR TONIGHT! Below is Chris' original event description:

I'll be at Richter's at College and Chapel Streets at 10:15-10:30 for some pre-movie drinks; perhaps a half-yard.


Alright now I get to do what I love best. Put up some quotes from this comic gem.

Wadsworth: But he was your second husband. Your first husband also disappeared.
Mrs. White: But that was his job. He was an illusionist.
Wadsworth: But he never reappeared.
Mrs. White: He wasn't a very good illusionist.

Wadsworth: Professor Plum, you were once a professor of psychiatry specializing in helping paranoid and homicidal lunatics suffering from delusions of grandeur.
Professor Plum: Yes, but now I work for the United Nations.
Wadsworth: So your work has not changed.

Professor Plum: What are you afraid of, a fate worse than death?
Mrs. Peacock: No, just death, isn't that enough?

Mr. Green: So it was you. I was going to expose you.
Wadsworth: I know. So I choose to expose myself.
Colonel Mustard: Please, there are ladies present!

Wadsworth: At the start of the evening, I was in the hall. I know because I was there.

Wadsworth: Three murders?
Mr. Green: Six altogether.
Wadsworth: This is getting serious.

Mrs. Peacock: Uh, is there a little girl's room in the hall?
Yvette: Oui oui, Madame.
[points]
Mrs. Peacock: No, I just have to powder my nose.

Husbands should be like Klenex--soft, strong, and disposable.


Wadsworth:
Don't deny it.
Mrs. White:
What do you mean, "don't deny it"? I'm not denying anything.
Wadsworth:
Another denial.

Eric's contact number is: 860-214-9361. We'll be taking our seats at about 11:20p, so if you're late, just come on in! Tickets are $5, but if you find me before the show (and give me $4 cash) I can get you the discounted rate.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby at 11:15p; tall, attractive guy with glasses.
item.name: This is war Peacock. Casualties are inevitable.
